        Summary:
Conakry is the capital and largest city of Guinea, a port city that serves as the economic, financial, and cultural center of the country. It has a population of approximately 1.6 million people. The city's economy revolves around the port, which handles cargo such as alumina and bananas, and also includes manufacturing of food products, cement, metal, and fuel products. Conakry International Airport, also known as Gbessia International Airport, serves the city. Conakry became the capital of French colonial Riviéres du Sud in 1891 and is designated as the Conakry Special Zone at the second-tier prefecture level. It is the largest city in Guinea, making up almost a quarter of the nation's population.
